publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1557# Patricia Ferguson: Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal—That the Parliament congratulates Mr Iain Hay Gordon on winning his long battle to clear his name of the "Guilty But Insane" verdict passed against him following the murder of Patricia Curran in 1952 and further congratulates all those who have assisted Mr Gordon in overturning what may be the longest miscarriage of justice in British history.

S1M-1557# Patricia Ferguson: Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal—That the Parliament congratulates Mr Iain Hay Gordon on winning his long battle to clear his name of the "Guilty But Insane" verdict passed against him following the murder of Patricia Curran in 1952 and further congratulates all those who have assisted Mr Gordon in overturning what may be the longest miscarriage of justice in British history.
S1M-1557# Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal (lodged on 17 January 2001) Cathie Craigie*, Pauline McNeill*, Irene Oldfather*
S1M-1557# Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal (lodged on 17 January 2001) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1557# Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal (lodged on 17 January 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1557# Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal (lodged on 17 January 2001) Nora Radcliffe*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-1557# Patricia Ferguson: Iain Hay Gordon’s Acquittal—That the Parliament congratulates Mr Iain Hay Gordon on winning his long battle to clear his name of the "Guilty But Insane" verdict passed against him following the murder of Patricia Curran in 1952 and further congratulates all those who have assisted Mr Gordon in overturning what may be the longest miscarriage of justice in British history. Supported by: Cathie Craigie, Pauline McNeill, Irene Oldfather, Donald Gorrie, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie
S1M-1557# Iain Hay Gordon's Acquittal (lodged on 17 January 2001) Dr Winnie Ewing*
